Headlines: Successful End of NASA Moon Mission Shifts Attention to SpaceX
News: The Orion capsule’s splashdown in the Pacific Ocean moved NASA into the next stages of the Artemis program, which will rely on Elon Musk’s rocket company to build a moon lander for astronauts.

Headlines: In a Future Filled With Electric Cars, AM Radio May Be Left Behind
News: Carmakers say electromagnetic interference causes static and noise on AM transmissions, annoying customers. Broadcasters say they could lose a connection to their core listeners, who rely on the radio for emergencies.

Headlines: The New Chatbots Could Change the World. Can You Trust Them?
News: Siri, Google Search, online marketing and your child’s homework will never be the same. Then there’s the misinformation problem.

Headlines: They’re Taking Jigsaws to Infinity and Beyond
News: In upstate New York, two algorithmic artists make wooden puzzles inspired by natural forms.

Headlines: Sam Bankman-Fried Agrees to Testify Before House Committee
News: The FTX founder said on Twitter that he will appear before a House committee next week, but was quiet about a similar request from a Senate committee.

Headlines: F.T.C. Sues to Block Microsoft’s $69 Billion Acquisition of Activision
News: The move by the commission signals an aggressive stance by federal regulators to thwart the expansion of the tech industry’s biggest companies.

Headlines: No. 2 Theranos Executive Is Sentenced to Nearly 13 Years for Fraud
News: Ramesh Balwani, the former chief operating officer of the failed blood testing start-up, was convicted of 12 counts of fraud in July.

Headlines: Apple Details Plans to Beef Up Encryption of Data in Its iCloud
News: The move could frustrate law enforcement efforts to circumvent the already tough security of iPhones.

Headlines: Indiana Sues TikTok for Security and Child Safety Violations
News: The lawsuits are the first by an American state against TikTok, which is owned by the Chinese company ByteDance, in a sign of mounting legal pressure.

Headlines: Why Losing to Meta in Court May Still Be a Win for Regulators
News: As the Federal Trade Commission prepares to face off in court against Meta over a V.R. start-up deal, the agency is testing a novel argument as part of a strategy to push antitrust law.
